outside.name: Outside the Shopfront
outside.description:
You stand on rain-speckled pavement facing a narrow tech shop. Retro consoles and motherboards huddle behind misted glass, their LEDs blinking like polite fireflies. The neon above the doorway flickers, but the letters smear in the drizzle before you can read them.

Something small glints near the threshold. The street smells of wet tarmac and warm circuitry. You could step IN to the shop, cross the STREET to the house, wander toward the TRAIN station, or follow the path to the COAST.

store.name: Metaphora â€” Tech Shop
store.description:
You slip inside; the door hushes behind you as if reluctant to let the weather in. Shelves of prepaid codes for distant models stand to attention, each card a promise of borrowed cleverness. Piles of personal AI boxes wait mid-journey across the floor, abandoned in a rush. A post-it flaps from one like a reluctant confession.

To your left the aisles tilt toward games; to your right, cameras and edit bays. The counter faces the entrance, a brass bell patiently guarding a heavy door behind it with a keyhole etched BACKDOOR-KEY-1.

store_content.name: Content Studio Corner
store_content.description:
Tripods and ring lights form a polite thicket around a long editing desk. Coffee rings stencil circles on to-do lists about scripts, devlogs, and some video no one quite feels ready to finish. USB drives spill from a ceramic bowl like sweets. A half-packed camera bag lies open, the way someone leaves when they plan to return soon.

The hum from the shop floor drifts in, mingling with the faint sound of waves from a video paused mid-frame.

store_games.name: Retro Video-Games Aisle
store_games.description:
This side of the shop smells of cardboard ink and nostalgia. Posters for Tomb Raider and Final Fantasy VII curl proudly on the wall. A towering cardboard standee for LittleBigPlanet grins with that big colourful font, BAFTA laurel stamped on its sleeve. Stacks of games spill across the shelf, multiple copies of the same titles like someone could not bear to part with any variant.

One battered LittleBigPlanet box has been turned around, a handwritten note visible through cracked plastic. Someone left more than retail here.

backrooms.name: Backrooms Entrance
backrooms.description:
The air here tastes of dusted ozone and late-night decisions. Metal shelves climb the walls, half-filled with cables and prototypes that never met daylight. A whiteboard carries a maze of arrows linking dreams, deadlines, and doubts. Every hum from the server stack sounds like distant thunder clearing its throat.

The corridor narrows into shadow, but for now only the shop lies BACK the way you came.

home.name: House Across the Street
home.description:
You cross into a small house that feels lived-in rather than staged. Shoes gather by the door in hopeful pairs. Children's drawings and holiday photos frame the hallway, messy and sincere. A kettle cools on the counter beside a laptop left mid-thought, as if someone was interrupted by inspiration.

The warmth here presses gently against the storm outside. The STREET is the way back.

train_station.name: The Train Station
train_station.description:
The platform stretches longer than physics promised. Fog curls around rails that vanish into unhelpful distance. A split-flap board clicks through impossible destinations before settling on silence. The tannoy coughs occasionally, as if remembering it once had announcements to make.

It feels like a place designed for waiting and wondering. BACK to the storefront is the only direction that feels real.

coast_line.name: Coast Path
coast_line.description:
A narrow path spills out on to a slate coast. Waves batter the rocks with patient fury, spraying the air with salt and static. The horizon flickers between storm cloud and pale sunlight, unable to settle on a mood. Somewhere out there a gull laughs like it knows the punchline before you do.

There is only the path BACK toward the storefront unless you fancy asking the sea for advice.

quarter.name: tarnished quarter
quarter.description: A tarnished quarter from 1984, edges smoothed by anxious flipping. Someone scratched D.N. into the metal. It's warmer than it ought to be, as if memory retains its own heat.
quarter.onUse: You flip the quarter. For a heartbeat the neon catches it mid-spin, casting constellations across your palm. It lands with a polite clink and the storm rehearses another rumble.

neon_signs.name: neon signs
neon_signs.description: Up close the flicker sharpens into letters: METAPHORA. The tubes buzz like thoughts trying to finish themselves. For a moment the M falters and you swear it nearly spells METAPHOR.

metaphora_plaque.name: brass plaque
metaphora_plaque.description: A brass plaque beside the door reads METAPHORA in patient lettering. Beneath, engraved smaller: 'Where memory meets tomorrow.' Tilt your head and it seems to wink back at you.

window_display.name: window display
window_display.description: Walkmen, pagers, consoles, and homebrew boards crowd the window. One Game Boy shows a level layout that rearranges when you blink. A camcorder's tiny screen loops a clip of someone soldering at 3am.

ai_gift_cards.name: AI access cards
ai_gift_cards.description: Plastic gift cards promise minutes with distant minds: GPT, Claude, bespoke tiny models. Each card has a scribbled note about latency, capability, and which ones make the best company at 2am.

personal_ai_boxes.name: stack of personal AI boxes
personal_ai_boxes.description: Cardboard towers of personal AI units lean like they are gossiping. Shipping labels mark destinations that never happened. Someone started arranging them alphabetically and then stopped midsentence.

postit_future.name: flapping post-it
postit_future.description: The post-it clings to a box corner. In messy handwriting: 'these are yet to happen'. Ink wobbles where the writer hesitated.

ai_box_warning.name: warning label
ai_box_warning.description: One of the boxes has a printed label: 'Don't use at your own risk!' The double negative makes it either a dare or a plea.

counter_bell.name: brass counter bell
counter_bell.description: A brass bell polished by hopeful customers. It waits atop the counter like an invitation to bother the void.
counter_bell.onUse: You ping the bell. The ring stretches into the shelves and fades. No clerk appears, unless you count the distant server hum perking up.

backdoor_door.name: backroom door
backdoor_door.description: A heavy door hides behind the counter, keyhole stamped BACKDOOR-KEY-1. The handle is cold, the paint chipped where impatient hands once tried their luck.
backdoor_door.onUse: The lock eyes your key choices. Without BACKDOOR-KEY-1 it stays politely shut; with it, the mechanism sighs and the corridor beyond inhales you.

editing_rig.name: editing rig
editing_rig.description: Dual monitors glow with paused timelines. Clips of family, code editors, and travel shots wait in tidy tracks. A note reads: 'voiceover later, softer this time'.

storyboard_stack.name: storyboard stack
storyboard_stack.description: Printed frames with sketches and arrows spread across the table. Margins are full of self-reminders: 'ship before the storm', 'be kinder on camera', 'remember why'.

content_drives.name: bowl of USB drives
content_drives.description: A ceramic bowl brims with labelled drives: prototypes, b-roll, experiments. One is tagged 'backup of backup (trust me)'.

retro_posters.name: retro posters
retro_posters.description: Sun-faded posters for Tomb Raider, Final Fantasy VII, and Crash Bandicoot cling to the wall. Each caption promises a world that once felt infinite.

lbp_standee.name: LittleBigPlanet standee
lbp_standee.description: A large cardboard Sackboy beams in bold, colourful font. A BAFTA award badge sits on the corner, proud and slightly peeled. Someone tucked a sticker under its foot reading 'build loudly / truthfully'.

lbp_box.name: battered LittleBigPlanet box
lbp_box.description: The cracked case has been turned backwards. Scrawled on the plastic: 'once a masterpiece, left in the few who remember'. When you tilt it, a faded insert whispers about co-creation and play.

demo_kiosk.name: demo kiosk
demo_kiosk.description: An old demo console loops a menu, joystick worn smooth. The screen invites: 'PRESS START IF YOU STILL BELIEVE IN SIDE QUESTS'.
demo_kiosk.onUse: You tap start. The screen flickers, briefly showing a line: 'BACKDOOR-KEY-1 tucked behind the standee' before returning to its looping menu. Helpful, if you trust haunted kiosks.

backdoor_key_1.name: BACKDOOR-KEY-1
backdoor_key_1.description: A plastic keycard on a frayed lanyard. Someone scribbled 'backrooms' on the back in marker. It smells faintly of popcorn and old carpet, as if it spent too long beside arcade machines.
backdoor_key_1.onUse: You slot the keycard into the backroom lock in your mind. You can almost hear the click. The door will believe you now.

server_rack.name: server rack
server_rack.description: A stack of humming machines exhale warm air. LEDs blink like a heartbeat practising mindfulness. A sticker reads: 'prototype builds / mind palace'.

whiteboard_map.name: whiteboard of arrows
whiteboard_map.description: Arrows connect bubbles labelled 'family', 'work', 'storm', 'videos', 'rest'. Some loops dead-end in smudges. Someone wrote 'remember to sleep' in the corner, underlined twice, then circled for luck.

backlog_crate.name: backlog crate
backlog_crate.description: A plastic crate holds notebooks and half-finished gadgets. A note taped to the lid reads: 'pick one, finish it, pretend the storm isn't louder today.'

family_frame.name: family frame
family_frame.description: A framed photo captures laughter mid-bloom. Someone's hair is mid-chaos, someone's eyes are squeezed shut. The joy is wonderfully imperfect.

shoe_stack.name: pile of shoes
shoe_stack.description: Shoes pile near the door, evidence of comings and goings. Tiny trainers rest beside running shoes, a timeline in footwear.

tiny_robot.name: tiny robot toy
tiny_robot.description: A 3D-printed robot with one arm missing and LEDs blinking a stubborn heartbeat. 'beta' is scribbled on its back in marker.

splitflap_board.name: split-flap board
splitflap_board.description: The split-flap board rattles through impossible destinations: MEMORY LANE, NEXT BUILD, SOMEDAY, SOONISH. Occasionally it pauses on a blank space, contemplating silence.
splitflap_board.onUse: You press the service button. The flaps whir, then settle on: 'NEXT TRAIN: WHEN YOU STOP HESITATING.' It immediately pretends it never said that.

waiting_bench.name: waiting bench
waiting_bench.description: A wooden bench worn smooth by patient dreamers. Someone carved 'CATCH YOUR BREATH' into the armrest and underlined it three times.

ghost_ticket.name: ghost ticket
ghost_ticket.description: A ticket stub with no date and no price, just 'ADMIT ONE: D.N. + GUEST' stamped in fading ink. It smells faintly of rain and printer toner.
ghost_ticket.onUse: You hold the ticket up to the flickering light. Letters rearrange to spell 'YOU'RE ALREADY ON BOARD' before dissolving back into smudges.

tidal_pool.name: tidal pool
tidal_pool.description: A shallow tidal pool mirrors the sky in miniature. Tiny crabs scuttle between pebbles beside a fragment of circuitry, as if the sea tried building a computer and got distracted.

driftwood_sign.name: driftwood sign
driftwood_sign.description: A piece of driftwood is wedged upright between rocks. Carved into it: 'BUILD LOUDLY', crossed out and replaced with 'TRUTHFULLY'. The wood creaks like it might offer more advice if you listen.

message_shell.name: message shell
message_shell.description: A pale shell holds a rolled scrap of paper. The note reads: 'if the storm gets loud, remember the coast is still here.' Salt has blurred the ink but not the intent.

friendly_stranger.name: friendly stranger
friendly_stranger.description: A person of indeterminate age leans against the storefront, jacket weatherproof and grin weathered. They watch the sky like a sailor watches a tide, amused and a little wary.
dialogue: "Lovely evening, isn't it? Well, it would be if the sky wasn't rehearsing something dramatic. Keep an eye on it, yeah?"
"You look like someone who builds things. Creative chaos in the eyes. Respect."
"Storm's coming. Best pick where you want to be when it hits: safe, daring, or both."
"That glint near the door? If you fancy luck, don't leave it to the pigeons."
"The shop's got layers. Left feels like childhood, right like deadlines, and behind the counter... well, that's where the storm keeps its notes."
